comment.body: Hi @garethbowen . This is still WIP because it's blocked by https://github.com/medic/cht-core/issues/8669, but I consider all required work done. Would you mind having a look?

`setValue` first empties the value and then adds another value. For a brief moment, a validation error for the field was displayed which prevented form submission. 
I suppose I could add the "wait for validation errors" workaround to `submitForm` as well ....

comment.body: The cookie expiry precision is second, not microsecond. We need to wait for a full second to make the test valuable.

comment.body:
the condition to `not` display export button is: 
```
 !this.selectMode && this.isOnlineOnly && this.hasExportPermission && !this.responsiveService.isMobile();
```

https://github.com/medic/cht-core/blob/07bcd95e2858f12b339777da5bcb05c63e470c8e/webapp/src/ts/modules/reports/reports-more-menu.component.ts#L142

Nothing in this test would prevent the export option from being displayed. I'm surprised this test ever passed.

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -60,10 +61,10 @@ describe('Send message', () => {
     await messagesPage.sendMessage(
       smsMsg(healthCenter.name),
       healthCenter.name,
-      `${healthCenter.name} - all  contacts`
+      `${healthCenter.name} - all`
comment.body: There's a weird thing happening here. The translation has an extra parameter that is empty, so when rendering there are theoretically 2 spaces between `all` and `contacts`, but that additional space makes selecting the element through text impossible.

issue.title: Enketo labels are not interactable

labels.name: Type: Bug
labels.description: Fix something that isn't working as intended

labels.name: Regression
labels.description: Affects a feature that worked in a previous release

issue.body:
**Describe the bug**
Due to labels now having `display: contents`, they are no longer interactable. This means they are visually rendered correctly, but they cannot receive clicks or other actions from the user. 
Latest version of WebdriverIO [requires elements to be interactable](https://webdriver.io/docs/api/element/getText/) in order to get or receive values from. This behavior can be also viewed in Chrome dev tools when hovering over elements. 

**To Reproduce**

**Expected behavior**
The user should be able to interact with elements that are visible on the page. 

**Logs**
Sample of wdio logs when trying to get text from labels: https://github.com/medic/cht-core/actions/runs/6649138918/job/18067409025#step:16:626

**Video
// in progress

**Environment**
- Browser: Chrome
- App: Webapp
- Version: 4.5

**Additional context**
Introduced by https://github.com/medic/cht-core/commit/a2d0ccab1f794ca31bfb7b9e223f783d49094469

issue.title: Changing a role from being "online" to "offline" does not also change behavior of existing users having this role

labels.name: Type: Bug
labels.description: Fix something that isn't working as intended

issue.body:
**Describe the bug**
Users can have a specific role flag `mm-online`, which determines whether they are online or offline users. This role is added or removed when the user is created or edited, depending on the list of roles that is provided for them. 
If a user is assigned to an role that is `online`, they will also be assigned this `mm-online` role. 
If the user's primary role is later changed, from being online to offline, any user that has this role will still be treated as `online`, because of the `mm-online` flag. 

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Create a new online role. 
2. Create a user with this online role. 
3. Edit the role and make it offline. 
4. Log in with the user and observe they are treated as an online user: they have access to all documents and do not have the app available when they are offline. 

**Expected behavior**
It should be clear that simply editing the role is not sufficient to changing the behavior of users that are assigned to this role. 
An alternative would be to edit the users every time a role is changed. 

**Environment**
- Instance: self hosted partner
- Version: all

**Additional context**
This came in through the forum: https://forum.communityhealthtoolkit.org/t/scope-report-viewing-to-specific-top-level-place/3092/9

comment.body:
I don't believe this will be a straight forward change so all users are edited when a role is changed kind of situation. 
Changing a user from being online to being offline, and vice-versa, while the user is logged in will produce all sorts of unexpected results, so propagating the role change to users can be seriously risky. 

Not providing any indication that the users won't be affected by the role edit needs to change.

issue.title: Changing a role from being "online" to "offline" does not also change status of existing users having this role

labels.name: Type: Bug
labels.description: Fix something that isn't working as intended

issue.body:
**Describe the bug**
Users can have a specific role flag `mm-online`, which determines whether they are online or offline users. This role is added or removed when the user is created or edited, depending on the list of roles that is provided for them. 
If a user is assigned to an role that is `online`, they will also be assigned this `mm-online` role. 
If the user's primary role is later changed, from being online to offline, any user that has this role will still be treated as `online`, because of the `mm-online` flag. 

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Create a new online role. 
2. Create a user with this online role. 
3. Edit the role and make it offline. 
4. Log in with the user and observe they are treated as an online user: they have access to all documents and do not have the app available when they are offline. 

**Expected behavior**
It should be clear that simply editing the role is not sufficient to changing the behavior of users that are assigned to this role. 
An alternative would be to edit the users every time a role is changed. 

**Environment**
- Instance: self hosted partner
- Version: all

**Additional context**
This came in through the forum: https://forum.communityhealthtoolkit.org/t/scope-report-viewing-to-specific-top-level-place/3092/9

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -92,11 +92,13 @@ jobs:
     runs-on: ubuntu-22.04
     env:
       NODE: 16.x
+      CHROME_VERSION: ${{ matrix.chrome-version }}
comment.body:
Not this line, but can we append `${{ matrix.chrome-version }}` to the test name, otherwise CI runs two builds with the same name. Perhaps we could just append it if it's not 90? For example, I don't know if this is value syntax but something like...

```
name: ${{ matrix.cmd }}-${{ matrix.suite || '' }}${matrix.chrome-version === '90' ? '-minimum-browser' : '' }
```

         mkdir -p allure-results/history
         cp -r build-history-data/cht-core/allure/${{ matrix.cmd }}-${{ matrix.suite }}/allure-report/history allure-results | true
-    - name: Run tests ${{ matrix.cmd }}-${{ matrix.suite }}
+    - name: Install Chrome 90
+      if: ${{matrix.chrome-version=='90'}}
+      run: |
+        wget -O "google-chrome-stable_current_amd64.deb" https://www.slimjet.com/chrome/download-chrome.php?file=files/90.0.4430.72/google-chrome-stable_current_amd64.deb
+        sudo dpkg -i "google-chrome-stable_current_amd64.deb"
+    - name: Install Chromedriver 90
+      if: ${{matrix.chrome-version=='90'}}
+      run: npm install chromedriver@^90.0.1
comment.body:
Let's merge these two together, ie:

```suggestion
    - name: Install Chrome 90
      if: ${{matrix.chrome-version=='90'}}
      run: |
        wget -O "google-chrome-stable_current_amd64.deb" https://www.slimjet.com/chrome/download-chrome.php?file=files/90.0.4430.72/google-chrome-stable_current_amd64.deb
        sudo dpkg -i "google-chrome-stable_current_amd64.deb"
        npm install chromedriver@^90.0.1
```

issue.title: Answers to non-relevant questions in forms are not immediately cleared with new Enekto

labels.name: Type: Bug
labels.description: Fix something that isn't working as intended

labels.name: Regression
labels.description: Affects a feature that worked in a previous release

issue.body:
**Describe the bug**
This is a known issue that _will be_ introduced by the [Enketo uplift](https://github.com/medic/cht-core/pull/7256). Logging this here ([as requested](https://github.com/medic/cht-core/issues/6345#issuecomment-1167946463) by @garethbowen) as a point of reference and discussion.

Basically, the issue (reported by @tatilepizs [here](https://github.com/medic/cht-core/issues/6345#issuecomment-1164635324)) is that on old versions of enketo-core, if a question that has already been answered becomes non-relevant (such as if the user goes back and changes a previous answer) the answer value for the non-relevant question would be immediately cleared out and its value would be no longer be available to any XPath expressions throughout the form. If the question became relevant again, the user would need to re-enter their answer.

Now, with the new version of enketo-core that we are uplifting to (`5.18.1`), the `clearIrrelevantImmediately` option [has been removed](https://github.com/enketo/enketo-core/commit/26fb7d47921a71a1af75e95e4e75f1556a6d7c6d) and this makes the behavior a little more complex.  When an answered question becomes non-relevant, it retains its answer value and if it becomes relevant again, the user will not have to re-enter the same answer. If the form is submitted while the question is still non-relevant, the value will be cleared out before the form data is saved.  Unfortunately, due to [this Enketo issue](https://github.com/enketo/enketo-core/issues/849) the answer value for a non-relevant question will still be available to XPath expressions throughout the form _while the form is being filled out_. When the form is submitted, these expressions will be re-evaluated without the answer value from the non-relevant question, but until then, the expressions will still see the non-relevant answer value.  This, of course, can cause inconsistencies between what is displayed in the form and what is actually saved in the report.

The good news is this inconsistency has [been fixed](https://github.com/enketo/enketo-core/pull/870) in version `6.1.0` of enketo-core which introduces a new `excludeNonRelevant` option (which is still off by default).  

The `excludeNonRelevant` option is not going to have identical behavior to the `clearIrrelevantImmediately` option, but I think the new behavior (where the form remembers what the user had answered before) is actually desirable and does not seem likely to cause issues with existing form config (as long as `excludeNonRelevant` is set to `true`).  

---

One important thing to keep in mind is that we also noticed issues with this behavior as it pertains to our [custom logic for the `inputs` group](https://github.com/medic/cht-core/issues/6345#issuecomment-1021342562).  However, the new logic with `excludeNonRelevant` is likely to break this `inputs` functionality again and this will need to be accounted for when upgrading enekto-core.

comment.body: I'm leaving it here hoping that by some miracle the enketo uplift makes it in to 4.5.0.

commits.message: Revert change in the test names
Add no-sandbox to prevent session not created chromedriver error
Change where to set CHROME_VERSION env
